pullRequest.body:
We add `Polynomial.nmem_nonZeroDivisors_iff`, known as McCoy's theorem: a polynomial `P : R[X]` is a zerodivisor if and only if there is `a : R` such that `a ‚â† 0` and `a ‚Ä¢ P = 0`.

- [x] depends on: #12958

Co-authored-by: <manelsadi12@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#12958~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

I've been hacking on this proof a bit more. I suggest first proving
```lean
theorem McCoy (f : R[X]) (h : ‚àÄ r : R, r ‚Ä¢ f = 0 ‚Üí r = 0) :
    ‚àÄ (g : R[X]), f * g = 0 ‚Üí g = 0 := by
  intro g hg
  by_contra hg‚ÇÄ
  have key : ‚àÉ i, g.leadingCoeff * f.coeff i ‚â† 0 := by
    contrapose! hg‚ÇÄ
    rw [‚Üê leadingCoeff_eq_zero]
    apply h
    simp [Polynomial.ext_iff, hg‚ÇÄ]
  have hnonempty : {i | f.coeff i ‚Ä¢ g ‚â† 0}.Nonempty := key.imp fun i hi ‚Ü¶ by
    rw [Set.mem_setOf_eq, ‚Üê leadingCoeff_ne_zero, smul_eq_C_mul, leadingCoeff_mul']
    all_goals rwa [leadingCoeff_C, mul_comm]
  have hbdd : BddAbove {i | f.coeff i ‚Ä¢ g ‚â† 0} := by
    use f.natDegree
    intro i (hi : f.coeff i ‚Ä¢ g ‚â† 0)
    contrapose! hi
    rw [coeff_eq_zero_of_natDegree_lt hi, zero_smul]
  let m := g.natDegree
  let l := sSup {i | f.coeff i ‚Ä¢ g ‚â† 0}
  have hl : f.coeff l ‚Ä¢ g ‚â† 0 := Nat.sSup_mem hnonempty hbdd
  suffices (f.coeff l ‚Ä¢ g).natDegree < g.natDegree by
    apply hl
    apply McCoy f h (f.coeff l ‚Ä¢ g)
    rw [smul_eq_C_mul, mul_left_comm, hg, mul_zero]
  suffices f.coeff l * g.leadingCoeff = 0 by
    apply (natDegree_smul_le (f.coeff l) g).lt_of_ne
    contrapose! hl
    rwa [‚Üê leadingCoeff_eq_zero, ‚Üê coeff_natDegree, coeff_smul, hl, coeff_natDegree, smul_eq_mul]
  suffices (f * g).coeff (l + m) = f.coeff l * g.leadingCoeff by rw [‚Üê this, hg, coeff_zero]
  rw [coeff_mul]
  apply Finset.sum_eq_single (l, m) _ (by simp)
  simp only [Finset.mem_antidiagonal, ne_eq, Prod.forall, Prod.mk.injEq, not_and]
  intro i j hij H
  obtain hi|rfl|hi := lt_trichotomy i l
  ¬∑ have hj : m < j := by omega
    rw [coeff_eq_zero_of_natDegree_lt hj, mul_zero]
  ¬∑ omega
  ¬∑ suffices f.coeff i ‚Ä¢ g = 0 by rw [‚Üê coeff_C_mul, ‚Üê smul_eq_C_mul, this, coeff_zero]
    contrapose! hi
    refine le_csSup hbdd hi
termination_by g => g.natDegree
```
using recursion.
@jcommelin I've modified the PR using your proof, thanks for the review!
@Ruben-VandeVelde I've reverted your last commit. `termination_by` does not like variables before the colon.

It feels like the proof of `eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero_of_smul` is slightly too complicated, but I can't figure out a way to simplify it (reordering proofs, trying `calc` blocks, etc.) So looks good to me, thanks!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9192331709/job/25280702548)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9192331709/job/25280702239)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9192331709/job/25280701807)

> It feels like the proof of `eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero_of_smul` is slightly too complicated, but I can't figure out a way to simplify it (reordering proofs, trying `calc` blocks, etc.) So looks good to me, thanks!
> 
> bors r+

I think the proof is indeed surprisingly tricky! There is a better proof using localization, but it requires a much bigger machinery (and I am not sure it works for semirings...).
lgtm as well
lgtm as well
Can you add `P ‚àà R[X]‚Å∞ ‚Üî ‚àÄ a : R, a ‚Ä¢ P = 0 ‚Üí a = 0`?
Done.

```suggestion
theorem nmem_nonZeroDivisors_iff {P : R[X]} : P ‚àâ R[X]‚Å∞ ‚Üî ‚àÉ a : R, a ‚â† 0 ‚àß a ‚Ä¢ P = 0 := by
```
maybe `protected` instead?
Ah yes, that's a good idea.

```suggestion
  simpa [not_imp_not] using (nmem_nonZeroDivisors_iff (P := P)).not
```

```suggestion
      apply Hdeg
      simp only [hm, sInf_eq_zero, Set.mem_image, Set.image_eq_empty]
```

```suggestion
theorem eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero_of_smul (P : R[X]) (h : ‚àÄ r : R, r ‚Ä¢ P = 0 ‚Üí r = 0)
    (Q : R[X]) (hQ : P * Q = 0) : Q = 0 := by
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.RingDivision): add Polynomial.nmem_nonZeroDivisors_iff
